methods.name: OperationStatus
methods.doc:
This property indicates the ON/OFF status.

ON＝0x30，OFF＝0x31

Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : mandatory

Announcement at status change

methods.name: InstallationLocation
methods.doc:
This property indicates the installation location

See “2.2 ‘Installation location’ property.”

Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : mandatory
Get : mandatory

Announcement at status change

methods.name: StandardVersionInformation
methods.doc:
This property indicates the version number of the corresponding standard.

First byte: Fixed at 0x00 (for future reserved).
Second byte: Fixed at 0x00 (for future reserved).
Third byte: Indicates the order of release in the ASCII format.
Fourth byte: Fixed at 0x00 (for future reserved).

Data Type : unsigned char×4
Data Size(Byte) : 4

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : mandatory

methods.name: IdentificationNumber
methods.doc:
A number that allows each object to be uniquely identified.

First byte: lower-layer communication ID field
0x01－0xFD：This is a communication protocol used in the lower-layer communication and is set arbitrarily according to the protocol class in the case where unique number is assigned (not used in ECHONET Lite).
0x11－0x1F: Power line Communication Protocol A and B systems
0x31-0x3F: Designated low-powor radio
0x41-0x4F: Extended HBS
0x51-0x5F: IrDA
0x61-0x6F: LonTalk®
0x71-0x7F: BlueTooth
0x81-0x8F: Ethernet
0x91-0x9F: IEEE802.11/11B
0xA1: Power line Communication Protocol C systems
0xB2：IPv6/6LoWPAN
0xFE：2－17 bytes are defined by the manufacturer, and are set according to the type.
0xFF：2－9 bytes are defined when randomly generated protocol is used in the lower-layer communication.
0x00：Identification number is not set.
Second and succeeding bytes: unique number field

Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 9 or 17

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: MeasuredInstantaneousPowerConsumption
methods.doc:
This property indicates the instantaneous power consumption of the device in watts.

0x0000-0xFFFF（0-65535W）

Data Type : unsigned short
Data Size(Byte) : 2

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: MeasuredCumulativePowerConsumption
methods.doc:
This property indicates the cumulative power consumption of the device in increments of 0.001kWh.

0x0-0x3B9AC9FF（0-999,999.999kWh）

Data Type : unsigned long
Data Size(Byte) : 4

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: ManufacturersFaultCode
methods.doc:
This property indicates the manufacturer-defined fault code.

First byte: Indicates the data size of the fault code field.
Second to fourth bytes: Manufacturer code
Fifth and succeeding bytes: Field for manufacturer-defined fault code

Data Type : unsigned char×(MAX)225
Data Size(Byte) : Max 225

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: CurrentLimitSetting
methods.doc:
This property indicates the current limit setting (0-100%).
0x00-0x64 （=0-100%）

Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

methods.name: FaultStatus
methods.doc:
This property indicates whether a fault (e.g. a sensor trouble) has occurred or not.

Fault occurred＝0x41, No fault has occurred＝0x42

Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : mandatory

Announcement at status change

methods.name: FaultDescription
methods.doc:
Describes the fault.

See “2.5 ‘Fault Description’ Property.”

Data Type : unsigned short
Data Size(Byte) : 2

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: ManufacturerCode
methods.doc:
3-byte manufacturer code

(Defined by the ECHONET Consortium.)

Data Type : unsigned char×3
Data Size(Byte) : 3

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : mandatory

methods.name: ￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼￼BusinessFacilityCode
methods.doc:
3-byte business facility code

（Defined by each manufacturer.）

Data Type : unsigned char×3
Data Size(Byte) : 3

AccessRule

Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: ProductCode
methods.doc:
Identifies the product usingASCI I code.
（Defined by each manufacturer.）

Data Type : unsigned char×12
Data Size(Byte) : 12

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: ProductionNumber
methods.doc:
This property indicates the production number using ASCI I code.

（Defined by each manufacturer.）

Data Type : unsigned char×12
Data Size(Byte) : 12

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: ProductionDate
methods.doc:
4-byte production date code

This property indicates the product ion date in the YYMD format (1 character = 1 byte) .
YY： Year (e.g. 1999＝ 0x07CF)
M： Month (e.g. December＝0x0C)
D： Day (e.g. 20th＝ 0x14)

Data Type : unsigned char×4
Data Size(Byte) : 4

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: PowerSavingOperationSetting
methods.doc:
This property indicates whether the device is operating in power-saving mode.

Operating in power-saving mode =0x41
Operating in normal operation mode =0x42

Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

methods.name: PositionInformation
methods.doc:
This property indicates the latitude, longitude and altitude of the installation location.

Data Type : unsigned char×16
Data Size(Byte) : 16

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

Announcement at status change

methods.name: CurrentTimeSetting
methods.doc:
Current time (HH：MM format)

0x00-0x17：0x00-0x3B（ ＝ 0-23）：（ ＝ 0-59）

Data Type : unsigned char×2
Data Size(Byte) : 2

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

methods.name: CurrentDateSetting
methods.doc:
Current date (YYYY：MM：DD format)

1 ～ 0x270F ： 1 ～ 0x0C ： 1 ～ 0x1F (=1 ～ 9999) ： (=1 ～ 12) ： (=1 ～ 31)

Data Type : unsigned char×4
Data Size(Byte) : 4

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

methods.name: PowerLimitSetting
methods.doc:
This property indicates the power limit setting in watts.

0x0000~0xFFFF（0-65535W）

Data Type : unsigned short
Data Size(Byte) : 2

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

methods.name: CumulativeOperatingTime
methods.doc:
This property indicates the cumulative number of days, hours, minutes or seconds for which the device has operated, using 1 byte for the unit and 4 bytes for the time.

First byte: Indicates the unit.
Second： 0x41; Minute： 0x42; Hour： 0x43; Day:0x44
Second to fifth bytes ：
Indicates the elapsed time in the unit specified by the first byte. 0x00000000-0xFFFFFFFF (0-4294967295)

Data Type : unsigned char + unsigned long
Data Size(Byte) : 1+4 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: ElectricEnergyMeterClassification
methods.doc:
This property indicates the electric energy meter type.

Name : Electric energy meter classification
EPC : 0xD0
Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

methods.doc:
This property indicates the type of the owner of the meter.

0x30�FNot specified 0x31�FElectric utility company 0x32�FPrivate sector company 0x33�FIndividual

Name : Owner classification

AccessRule
Announce : undefined

methods.name: ConfigurationInformationOfPhasesAndWiresOfTheSystems
methods.doc:
This property indicates the configuration regarding the phases and wires of the system.

Single-phase, two-wire system�F 0x30 Single-phase, three-wire system�F 0x31 Three-phase, three-wire system�F 0x32 Three-phase, four-wire system�F 0x33

Name : Configuration information of phases and wires of the systems
EPC : 0xD2
Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: CompositeTransformationRatio
methods.doc:
This property indicates the composite transformation ratio using a 6-digit decimal notation number (initial value = 1).

0x00000000-0x000F423F (000000-999999)

Name : Composite transformation ratio
EPC : 0xD3
Data Type : unsigned long
Data Size(Byte) : 4 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: MultiplyingFactorForCompositeTransformationRatio
methods.doc:
This property indicates the multiplying factor for the composite transformation ratio.

0x00�F�~1(initial value) 0x01�F�~0.1 0x02�F�~0.01 0x03�F�~0.001

Name : Multiplying factor for composite transformation ratio
EPC : 0xD4
Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: MeterTypeCertificationNumberTypeApprovalNumberInJapan
methods.doc:
This property indicates the type-certified meter number using alphanumeric characters (0x20-0x70).

Type-certified meter (type number): 0000-0��������- 9999-9�������� Non-type certified meter: FFFFFFFFFF (initial value)

Name : Meter type certification number (type approval number in Japan)
EPC : 0xD5
Data Type : unsigned char x 10
Data Size(Byte) : 10 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : mandatory

methods.name: VerificationExpirationDate
methods.doc:
This property indicates, in the form of an ASCII code, the month and year in which the verification of the meter will expire.

YYYYMM YYYY (Year), MM (Month)

Name : Verification expiration date
EPC : 0xD6
Data Type : unsigned char x 6
Data Size(Byte) : 6 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

methods.name: MeasuredCumulativeAmountOfElectricEnergyNormalDirection
methods.doc:
This property indicates the measured cumulative amount of electric energy using an 8-digit decimal notation number.

0x00000000-0x05F5E0FF (0-99,999,999)

Name : Measured cumulative amount of electric energy (normal direction)
EPC : 0xE0
Data Type : unsigned long
Data Size(Byte) : 4 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : mandatory

methods.name: UnitForCumulativeAmountsOfElectricEnergyNormalAndReverseDirections
methods.doc:
This property indicates the unit (multiplying factor) used for the measured cumulative amount of electric energy and the historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy.

0x00: 1kWh 0x01: 0.1kWh 0x02: 0.01kWh 0x03: 0.001kWh (Initial value) 0x04: 0.0001kWh 0x0A: 10kWh 0x0B: 100kWh 0x0C: 1000kWh 0x0D: 10000kWh

Name : Unit for cumulative amounts of electric energy (normal and reverse directions)
EPC : 0xE1
Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : mandatory

methods.name: HistoricalDataOfMeasuredCumulativeAmountsOfElectricEnergyNormalDirection
methods.doc:
This property indicates the day for which the historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy is to be retrieved and the historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy (8 digits), which consists of 48 pieces of half-hourly data for the preceding 24 hours.

0x0000-0x0063: 0x00000000-0x05F5E0FF (0-99) : (0-99,999,999)

Name : Historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy (normal direction)
EPC : 0xE2
Data Type : unsigned short + unsigned long x48
Data Size(Byte) : 194 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: MeasuredCumulativeAmountOfElectricEnergyReverseDirection
methods.doc:
This property indicates the measured cumulative amount of electric energy using an 8-digit decimal notation number.

0x00000000-0x05F5E0FF (0-99,999,999)

Name : Measured cumulative amount of electric energy (reverse direction)
EPC : 0xE3
Data Type : unsigned long
Data Size(Byte) : 4 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: HistoricalDataOfMeasuredCumulativeAmountsOfElectricEnergyReverseDirection
methods.doc:
This property indicates the day for which the historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy is to be retrieved and the historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy (8 digits), which consists of 48 pieces of half-hourly data for the preceding 24 hours.

0x0000-0x0063: 0x00000000-0x05F5E0FF (0-99) : (0-99,999,999)

Name : Historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy (reverse direction)
EPC : 0xE4
Data Type : unsigned short �{ unsigned long �~48
Data Size(Byte) : 194 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: DayForWhichTheHistoricalDataOfMeasuredCumulativeAmountsOfElectricEnergyIsToBeRetrieved
methods.doc:
This property indicates the day for which the historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy (which consists of 48 pieces of half-hourly data for the preceding 24 hours) is to be retrieved.

0x00-0x63 ( 0-99) 0: current day 1 . 99: previous day . day that precedes the current day by 99 days

Name : Day for which the historical data of measured cumulative amounts of electric energy is to be retrieved
EPC : 0xE5
Data Type : unsigned char
Data Size(Byte) : 1 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : optional
Get : optional

methods.name: MeasuredInstantaneousAmountOfElectricEnergy
methods.doc:
This property indicates the measured effective instantaneous amount of electric energy in watts.

0x80000001-0x7FFFFFFD (-2,147,483,647- 2,147,483,645)

Name : Measured instantaneous amount of electric energy
EPC : 0xE7
Data Type : signed long
Data Size(Byte) : 4 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: MeasuredInstantaneousCurrents
methods.doc:
This property indicates the measured effective instantaneous R and T phase currents in amperes. In the case of a single-phase, two-wire system, 0x7FFE shall be used for the T phase.

0x8001-0x7FFD�iR phase�j : 0x8001-0x7FFD�iT phase�j (-3,276.7-3,276.5): (-3,276.7-3,276.5)

Name : Measured instantaneous currents
EPC : 0xE8
Data Type : signed short �~2
Data Size(Byte) : 4 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional

methods.name: MeasuredInstantaneousVoltages
methods.doc:
This property indicates the measured effective instantaneous R-S(N) and S(N)-T voltages in volts. In the case of a single-phase, two-wire system, 0xFFFE shall be used for the S(N)-T voltage.

0x0000-0xFFFD (between R and S(N))�F 0x0000-0xFFFD (between S(N) and T) (0-6,553.3) : (0-6,553.3)

Name : Measured instantaneous voltages
EPC : 0xE9
Data Type : unsigned short �~2
Data Size(Byte) : 4 Byte

AccessRule
Announce : undefined
Set : undefined
Get : optional
